clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For the prevention of nausea and vomiting associated with highly emetogenic cancer chemotherapy including high dose cisplatin in combination with other antiemetic agents

contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Aprepitant an antiemetic is a substance P neurokinin 1 NK1 receptor antagonist which in combination with other antiemetic agents is indicated for the prevention of acute and delayed nausea and vomiting associated with initial and repeat courses of highly emetogenic cancer chemotherapy Aprepitant is a selective high affinity antagonist of human substance P neurokinin 1 NK1 receptors Aprepitant has little or no affinity for serotonin 5 HT sub 3 sub dopamine and corticosteroid receptors the targets of existing therapies for chemotherapy induced nausea and vomiting CI NV
